medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Night sweats developed 1 week before admission, attributed to summer heat. Three days before admission, sharp abdominal pain started, rated up to 7/10 in intensity. Pain lasted up to 2.5 hours, increased with deep breaths, worse 1-2 hours after meals, associated with mild nausea, belching, hiccups, bloating, and loose gray stools. Symptoms did not improve with simethicone or ibuprofen. Pain recurred with increased severity on admission day.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Psoriasis since 10 years of age, a few episodes of vertigo with ear fullness during the past year, diagnosed with erythema nodosum 3 years prior, previous cellulitis from methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, appendectomy, herniorrhaphy, and turbinectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diverticulitis, father had hypertension, siblings healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Drinks alcohol in moderation, does not smoke or use illicit drugs; married and works in a medical facility.
